intro: Pedicularis megalochila subsp. megalochila, commonly known as the giant lip orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble a lip, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are pollinated by bees and other insects. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger floral structures compared to other members of the Pedicularis genus.
